renderedFields.description:
Background: Plaid provides endpoints for bank account ID information. This will allow us to pull relevant KYC info for the business.

User Value: As a user I can just provide Tradeshift my bank account log in rather than locate all of the KYC info myself.

When the user inputs their bank account information
Backend will access Plaid
And return identity information

Need to create endpoints for the Plaid API to do this

https://plaid.com/docs/#identity

Acceptance Criteria

  • Create endpoint to consume identity info
    • Name
    • Address
    • Email
  • Save these in IEP and attach to supplier profile

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

renderedFields.description:
As a developer, I should be able to access Plaid’s sandbox/developer environment to test all Plaid implementations.

All documentation for Plaid can be found here - https://plaid.com/docs/

Acceptance Criteria -

  • API authentication is setup with IEP
  • Test endpoints using Postman or similar client and verify data is returned by Plaid

renderedFields.description:
Context:
There is currently no server side validation of onboarding documents. This means that clients can theoretically upload any document to Tradeshift Early Payments while filling out an onboarding.

Action:
As a developer, I need to restrict file type uploads on the server side to JPEG, PNG, and PDF in the Onboarding Controller.

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.description:
*Context:*
There is currently no server side validation of onboarding documents. This means that clients can _theoretically_ upload _any document_ to Tradeshift Early Payments while filling out an onboarding.

*Action:*
As a developer, I need to restrict file type uploads on the server side to *JPEG*, *PNG*, and *PDF* in the Onboarding Controller.
fields.summary: Add server-side document validation for onboarding documents

renderedFields.description:
As a developer, I want to understand why Sentry does not have more errors so we can surface more errors and fix them before our customers see them.

Acceptance criteria:

  • Understand what errors are currently sent to Sentry
  • Understand what errors are not currently sent to Sentry
  • Create new pattern for how we can update the codebase so more errors are sent to Sentry

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.description:

fields.summary: Figure out why more errors are not in Sentry

renderedFields.description:
As a developer, I want to be able to read the lines of code in Sentry that caused an error so I can better identify the cause of the error.

Acceptance criteria:

  • Source maps are shipped to Sentry so errors are shown against unminified code
  • Source maps are not available to browsers in sandbox / production
  • If possible, source maps are available to browsers in local / kube-stack (create another story if not simple to include)

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

renderedFields.description:
As an end-user forced to use a super old browser, I don't want the app to break on me just because my company forces me to use outdated technology.

Acceptance criteria:

  • New JS methods (e.g. Object.fromEntries()) are either compiled down backwards compatible JS or errors are thrown when used
  • Need to support Firefox 56, IE 11, last two versions of other browsers

Things I tried that didn't work immediately:

adding to package.json:
"browserslist": "last 2 versions, IE 11, Firefox 56",

creating a .babelrc:
{
"presets": [
[
"tradeshift-scripts/babel",
{
"targets":

{ "browsers": ["last 2 versions", "IE 11", "Firefox 56"] }

}
]
]
}

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.summary: Protect against errors when using new JS methods

renderedFields.description:
As an enrollment manager

I want to view categories of sellers that are relevant to a cash program

So i can easily manage them

Acceptance Criteria:

  • Following categories should be represented
    • Eligible but Not yet invited to a cash program
    • Active in cash program
    • Enrollment in process (Enrolling?)
    • Approved by credit manager and ready to activate
    • Rejected by credit manager or TS
    • Discontinued

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.description:
As an enrollment manager

I want to view categories of sellers that are relevant to a cash program

So i can easily manage them



Acceptance Criteria:

* Following categories should be represented
** *Eligible* but Not yet invited to a cash program
** *Active* in cash program
** Enrollment in process (*Enrolling?*)
** Approved by credit manager and *ready to activate*
** *Rejected* by credit manager or TS
** *Discontinued*

renderedFields.description:
As a supplier, I want to be able to continue using the existing enrollment flow until the new one has been released to prod.

Acceptance criteria:

  • existing enrollments are not affected by new enrollment flow - still can be completed as before
  • we can ship new enrollment flow code to prod
  • there is a way to turn on the new enrollment flow at runtime so we can see how it would work in sandbox

renderedFields.description:
• For Seller Users
  • Who have received a Cash offer
  • The Complete Enrollment Process
  • Is a functionality
  • That lets them complete all the necessary steps to participate in the cash program

Additional information

  • Steps in the flow
    • View Program Details (post v1)
    • Review and complete company info, select participating buyers
    • Provide documentation, KYC, legal info etc.
    • Review/download enrollment letter & Accept Terms & conditions and submit for review
  • Supplier data needs to be read in from supplier profile
  • Input data and updated data to be saved to supplier profile
  • Information on step 3 feeding into the NOA
  • Documentation upload also saved to supplier profile
  • Data lake pull of invoice history
  • Data lake pull of invoice spot checks with each buyer
  • Ability to extract steps 3-6 into a supplier profile and send to Raistone automatically when whole process is complete
  • Tracking of which user is completing each step
    • intercom?

Open Questions

  1. Do we need a status change on SFDC (in review)
  2. Do we need a status change on product "Ready for review"?

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down. Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Epic

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.description:
* For Seller Users
* Who have received a Cash offer
* The Complete Enrollment Process
* Is a functionality
* That lets them complete all the necessary steps to participate in the cash program

*Additional information*

* Steps in the flow
** -View Program Details- (post v1)
** Review and complete company info, select participating buyers
** Provide documentation, KYC, legal info etc.
** Review/download enrollment letter & Accept Terms & conditions and submit for review
* Supplier data needs to be read in from supplier profile
* Input data and updated data to be saved to supplier profile
* Information on step 3 feeding into the NOA
* Documentation upload also saved to supplier profile
* Data lake pull of invoice history
* Data lake pull of invoice spot checks with each buyer
* Ability to extract steps 3-6 into a supplier profile and send to Raistone automatically when whole process is complete
* Tracking of which user is completing each step
** intercom?

*Open Questions*

# Do we need a status change on SFDC (in review)
# Do we need a status change on product "Ready for review"?

renderedFields.description:
• Given a user is accepting the funder terms
  • When they click on it
  • Then their information should be tracked and stored in a database table

Acceptance criteria:

  • The userId, date, time, and ip address for the person accepting the funding terms is logged
  • Able to pull a report of the data, along with user name and email from Tradeshift, to put in a spreadsheet

renderedFields.description:
Given a supplier is changed to closed configured in salesforce
When salesforce pushes us a supplier ID
Then the invoice history of that supplier should automatically be pulled and saved to the supplier profiles

Acceptance Criteria:

  • When a supplier goes to closed configured in salesforce it should trigger -
  • 2 year invoice history pulled from Caspian for each buyer the supplier is working with on this program
  • These should be saved to a supplier profile

renderedFields.description:
Given a supplier is changed to closed configured in salesforce
When salesforce pushes us a supplier ID
Then as sample invoice of every buyer connection should be pulled from the Data Lake API and saved to a supplier profile

Acceptance Criteria:

  • Supplier goes into closed configured
  • This triggers an API call to Caspian getting a sample invoice for each buyer-supplier pair to be financed
    • This needs to be the most recent invoice of the buyer-supplier pair and it needs to be the full PDF view of it.
  • This is then saved to the supplier profile

comments.body: accountid:5cfec89eceb3f20bc3b2bbed Please verify this is the right spot check

accountid:5c64aadf82b1b638507f2933 - in our current program, we need the full PDF invoice attached to the supplier profile for each buyer and supplier pairing. The main reason for this is to see if the invoice has been sold to another factoring company. One thing to note, we need the most recent invoice between a buyer and supplier relationship.
So we only need one? The most recent one?
We need the most recent invoice for each buyer/supplier pair.

accountid:5c64aadf82b1b638507f2933 one thing we might want to keep in mind is if we have a different opportunity type for “self enrollment”. We could probably mirror that opportunity type to also used close configure but will want to talk to Mari

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.description:
Given a supplier is changed to closed configured in salesforce
When salesforce pushes us a supplier ID
Then as sample invoice of every buyer connection should be pulled from the Data Lake API and saved to a supplier profile

Acceptance Criteria:

* Supplier goes into closed configured
* This triggers an API call to Caspian getting a sample invoice for each buyer-supplier pair to be financed
** This needs to be the most recent invoice of the buyer-supplier pair and it needs to be the full PDF view of it.
* This is then saved to the supplier profile

* Given a seller is being enrolled for a program
* When the enrollment manager is choosing the pricing option
* They should given a choice between “LIBOR +” or “FLAT”  for the field “Pricing Type”

Acceptance criteria:
* Enrollment creation form has fields to select "LIBOR +" or "Flat", same fields and label as program creation form
* Enrollment creation form is defaulted with values selected in program creation
fields.summary: Enable Seller Enrollment to Allow LIBOR

renderedFields.description:
• For Enrollment Managers
  • Who want to enroll sellers into a Cash program
  • this feature integrates SFDC with Tradeshift Cash platform
  • so that the enrollment managers have the latest seller data available to them in Tradeshift

Additional Details:

  • Applies to sellers in closed configure status
  • Store supplier profile data in IEP
  • Read KYC/Legal docs (PDFs) from SFDC
  • Auto-populate buyers in enrollment record

Background:

Salesforce is the tool sales is using to track and store all the customer information. As it stands now Ops has to manually re-enter this into TS. This is slow and error prone. Once the supplier moves into a finished state, the information should automatically flow into Tradeshift.

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down. Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Epic

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress
